quote_first: He glanced down at his watch. He had been smiling as he stroked her awake, and was smiling now. “
quote_last: . I sat in my stupid old motel room for almost two hours after we talked, trying to convince myself that what I was thinking couldn’t be true. Only I didn’t get where I am by dodging the truth.”
title: Full Dark, No Stars
author: Stephen King

quote_first: The young tinker girl knocked at the back door at
quote_time_case: quarter to three in the afternoon
quote_last: . Marjan recognized her as one of the many freckled faces that lingered at the café windows long after other curious schoolchildren had left their mucky handprints behind.

“What time is it?”
“Look for yourself,” the old woman says to me. I look, and I see the clock has no hands.
“There are no hands,” I say.
